pyCoalesce.utilities.API_request module¶

@author: sorr

This module provides a convenience function for making RESTful requests with exponential backoff (that is, if a request results in a transient error, the function makes the request again several times, with increasing delays between each attempt).

pyCoalesce.utilities.API_request.get_response(URL, method='get', verify=True, cert=None, params=None, data=None, json=None, headers=None, delay=1, max_attempts=8)¶

Make a RESTful API request with exponential backoff, and return the response. This is a wrapper for the requests package.

Parameters:
  • URL – the URL of the service to be called
  • method – the HTML method for making the request
  • verify – a flag indicating whether or not to verify the server’s certificate. This flag is only meaningful for SSL connections, and is necessary in development environments with servers using self-signed certificates.
  • cert – the path(s) to a client-side certificate and/or key. If separate certificate and key are to be passed, this should be a tuple of the two paths.
  • params – the parameters of the request
  • data – the data payload of the request. A payload submitted using this object will be transferred to the API server as a series of values joined by “&”.
  • json – a data payload in JSON form, or a PyThon object to be JSON-encoded
  • headers – the headers of the request
  • delay – the delay for the first retry. Later retries increase the delay by factors of 2.
  • max_attempts – the maximum number of times to attempt the request
Returns:

whatever response is returned for the request, as a requests.Response object
